quote: This whole world is running solely on the foundation of ‘wrong belief’. Why is there suffering in the world? It is because one has acquired the ‘wrong belief’. With the ‘right belief’, there is no suffering at all.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: belief, definition-of-beliefs, right-belief, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wrong-belief

quote: When the ‘right belief’ occurs, the world will appear quite different. ‘Right belief’ will take one towards the Eternal (Self), and the ‘wrong belief’ will take one towards the worldly life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: duniya, eternal, permanent-happiness, right-belief, sansar, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life, wrong-belief

quote: The belief of Gnan (Knowledge of the Self) is known as samkit (Right belief). Ignorant belief is known as mithyatva (illusion).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: illusion, knowledge-of-self, mithyatva, right-belief, samkit, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To attain the Self is indeed called the right belief (samkit).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: right-belief, samkit, self, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Right knowledge (samkit) means right vision. What does the wrong vision do? It will make one say, ‘this person caused me a loss. This person profited me. That person insulted me. That person hurt me. This person made me happy.’ There is no one out there giving you pain or pleasure! Indeed, it is all within you.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: importance-of-right-knowledge, meaning-of-samkit, result-of-right-vision, right-belief, right-knowledge, right-vision, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Anger-pride-deceit-greed; they are the ones giving you pain and only they are your enemies. There is no other enemy out there. There is only a nimit (evidentiary doer) outside. Wrong vision makes you accuse the nimit. When you attain the right belief (samkit), know that you have found the solution.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, deceit, define-enemie, greed, pain, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, what-is-nimit

quote: The Gnani Purush simply makes the separation in one’s vision: ‘This is the vision of the Soul, the real Self’ and ‘this is the vision of the worldly self’. Otherwise a person can never make this change in his vision. One’s vision of ‘I am Chandubhai’ (vikalpi drashti) will never become the vision of ‘I am the Pure Soul’ (nirvikalpi drashti).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: drasti, gnani, gnani-purush, nirvikalpi-drasti, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vikalpi-drasti, vision-of-soul, who-is-i, worldly

quote: When ‘my’ and ‘I’ are gone, it is known as a state free of wrong beliefs (nirvikalp)!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: relation-between-i-and-my, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is the benefit of egoism? It is only through the benefit of egoism that people get their daughters married, get their sons married, walk around as a father and say ‘mine, mine’! The entire world is enjoying the benefit of egoism. The Gnanis (Self-realized) enjoy the benefit of the Self.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: egoism, gnani, my-and-mine, relationship, self-realisation, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Maya (deceit) means that one cannot see the nature of things as they are but sees them in a different form.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: define-deceit, nature, science-behind-deceit, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, what-is-deciet

quote: To imagine the Self where it is not, is called maya (deceit).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: relation-between-self-deceit, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What do the Vitraag Lords say? “I am Chandulal” is a Gneya (that which is to be known) yet one believes himself to be the knower. When the knower comes into the ‘Knowing state (gnata padh) and that which is to be known, comes into the ‘state of being known (gneya padh)’, ‘we’ will call him ‘Jitendriya-Jin’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: jinendra, jitendriya-jin, knower, seer, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitarag-vignan, vitrag, vitrag-lords, vitrag-vani

quote: The path people know, is not the path of liberation. It is the path of the worldly life. The path of liberation is not one of imagination. It is a pure path. Where there are no worries, no externally created problems. There is bliss of the Self (samadhi) amidst all external problems.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: path-of-libbration, pathe-of-worldly-life, pure-path, samadhi, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The Lord states, ‘What can one do to go to moksha? He can go if he attains the right belief of the Self; or if he attains the grace of the Gnani Purush’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: gnani-purush, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-lord, way-to-moksha

quote: When egoism ends, that indeed is called the Absolute supreme Self (Parmatma). Egoism indeed is the illusion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: parmatma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, supreme-self, when-egoism-ends

quote: If a man keeps on talking negatively and we scold him, what is that tantamount to? It is like kicking the door of a latrine because it smells bad; will kicking it make it smell good?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: definition-of-negative-by-gnani, effect-of-negative-speech, negative, negative-speech, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To care for others is called humanity.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: care, care-for-others, humanity, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If one were to just understand the worldly life and what it is, he would attain liberation [moksha]. The worldly life is ‘relative’. And “All these relatives are temporary adjustments”.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absolute, liberation, moksha, relative-and-real, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: The Gnani Purush [The enlightened one] always remains untouched in his worldly interactions. Everything will get resolved for us if we go to Him. He shows us what is ‘correct’ and what is ‘incorrect’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: gnani, gnani-purush, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly

quote: When everyone in the family is united, when they resolve their issues with each other and unite; it is called vitarag bhav, attachment-free intent. And to disunite is to have raag-dwesh, attachment-abhorrence remain.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment-abhrrence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitrag, vitrag-vani, vitragbhav

quote: To say ‘I’ where I’ is not - is the greatest illusory attachment (raag).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, illusion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If attachment becomes fixed on a 'Gnani' [The enlightened one], then it becomes Real attachment (prashastaraag). It will get one’s work done. It will uproot attachment in all other places. Because the Gnani is Vitarag, attachment-free. Attachment for a Vitarag gives liberation from all the suffering.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: gnan, gnani, liberation, maening-of-enlightened, real-attachment, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitrag

quote: The kashays (inner anger, pride, deceit and greed) that keep one entrenched in the coolness of the worldly life are the very thing that makes one wander life after life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, cool, deceit, ego, egoism, greed, kashay, life, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quote, wander

quote: All those who are not straightforward (frank and forthright) in this world are full of deception.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: deceive, deception, frank, spiritual, spiritual-quote, straightforward

quote: As long as there is greed (desire) for even a single situation, one will have to come back into the world and wandering will continue until then.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, ego, greed, spiritual, spiritual-quote, wander, wandering, world

quote: Every human being is indeed unhappy as long as he is not free from kashays.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, deceit, ego, greed, human, human-being, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quote, unhappy

quote: The one whose kashays, (inner anger, pride, deceit, greed) are gone is worthy of worship. The absence of inner intent of kashays is indeed Gnani!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, deceit, ego, gnan, gnani, greed, gyan, gyani, inner-intent, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quote, worship

quote: Wherever there is kashay, there is no religion of the Vitarag at all. God does not want one to renounce anything. One needs to become free from kashays. Kashay-free state is considered the religion of moksha, while renouncing is considered religion of the world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absolute, dharma, god, kashay, kashay-free-preson, libration, moksha, parmatma, religions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitarag

quote: Where there is kashay, they are all considered heaps of parigraha (worldly possessiveness); whether one is living in the Himalayas or in a cave. Where there is absence of kashays, there is absence of possessiveness; even if one is then living in a palace!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absence-of-kashay, absence-of-possessivemess, heaps-of-possession-parigraha, himalayas-person, palace, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There should be no restlessness within, no matter what the circumstances. If there is restlessness within, know that the kashays have not left yet.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: kashay, kashay-free-preson, restless-within-you, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Wrong belief is what bites one from the inside. There is no one biting him on the outside.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: right-belief, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wrong-belief

quote: No human being really has any misery. It is your own mistake if you complain of the misery.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: hamanity, human-being, miseries, nature-of-human-being, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: You have a habit of having an ‘underhand’, and that is why you get a boss. Otherwise, no one is your boss and no one is your underhand; such is the world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One will have to know the Self. Unless Self is known, God [Allah] cannot be attained. The power of Self should be attained. The power of Self is an abode of infinite bliss. There is no unhappiness there at all. This happiness is there even if someone insults you!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: allah, god, happiness-and-unhappiness, infinite-bliss, self, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-power-of-self

quote: Bhagwan’ (God, Self) and ‘Paramatma’ (Supreme or absolute Self); these two words are spoken. Muslims speak the two words-‘Khuda’ (God, Self) and ‘Allah’ (Supreme spirit, Absolute Self). Allah is used for Paramatma and Khuda is used for Bhagwan.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absolute-self, allah, allah-vs-khuda, bhagwan, bhagwan-vs-parmatma, god, khuda, paramatma, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, supreme-spirit

quote: What is the one going to Moksha (attaining Liberation) like? He is someone who enjoys only the bliss of the ‘Self’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, how-to-go-to-moksha, libration, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Unless the Self is known, the power of the Self (swa satta) cannot arise.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: power-of-the-self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swa-satta

quote: When they say that, ‘God takes avatar (reincarnates)’ is incorrect. He is known as an avatari when last two or three incarnations (before Moksha) remain. God does not have the ability at all to do karma! Man does not have that ability either. It is due to illusion that he feels ‘I did it’!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: can-god-take-reincarnates, god, god-and-reincarnation, is-god-to-do-karmas, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, what-god-does, what-is-illusion, wrong-belief

quote: Religion is that which becomes the religion and gives results. When can we say it is this way? It is when it helps when someone insults you. It will not let you be affected by it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insults-result, is-religion-gives-result, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Is it wrong worldly interaction (avyavahar) when someone insults you? It is (correct) worldly interaction (vyavahar). Gnani (Self-realized person) will be pleased that he has become free from karma bondage, when someone insults Him; while a non Self-realized person will fight back.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: gnani, interaction, karma-bonadage, self, self-realized-preson, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, what-is-bondage, what-is-gnani-do-for-our-karmas

quote: Not doing attachment-abhorrence (raag-dwesh) while experiencing the unfolding of karma is religion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment-abhorrence, is-karma-is-religion, raag-dwesh, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Everyone’s unfolding karma will change. To maintain equanimity during the unfolding of karmic effect is the Gnanis’ (Self-realized person’s) duty.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: define-unfolding-karmas, gnani-purush, self-realizes-person, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, unfolding-karmas, what-gnani-does

quote: Egoism does not have eyes of its own. Some days, it sees through the eyes of the intellect (buddhi). However, what will happen if you befriend a blind man?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: egoism, function-of-egoism-intellect, intellect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is infinite energy within you. Whatever you think within, that very same thing will happen on the outside! However, here one chases his thoughts and works hard for things and yet nothing happens on the outside, people have incurred so much loss! Kaliyug (the time-cycle with lack of unison of mind, speech and body) is upon us!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: body, energy, infinite, kaliyug, mind, satyug, speech, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, thought, time-cycle

quote: God has said not to create any accounts (karmic). Create accounts (only) if you have the knowledge of the future. Hey! If you want to start an account, then why don’t you account for the possibility that you may die tomorrow?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: death, future-life, god, karma, knowledge-of-the-future, life, parmatma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: In reality, those who cheat are indeed the ones who get cheated. Those who are cheated will gain experience and develop (spiritually) in the process. Only money earned dishonestly will be taken away (by nature) from one; rightfully earned money will be put to good use!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cheat, dishonest, earn-money, experience, money, reality, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The one who knowingly gets cheated is entitled to liberation!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cheat, liberation, mokhsh, moksha, self, self-realisation, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no progress (spiritual) in this world like the one that comes from being cheated knowingly. This is a very high principle.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cheat, principle, progress, self, self-realisation, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, world

quote: Illusion (maya) makes one take birth, illusion makes one get married and illusion also makes one die. But here the condition is that it is not the reign of illusion. It is your own reign. It cannot happen unless you wish for it. Illusion gives the result (effect) of what you had consented to in your past life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: birth, death, illusion, marriage, past-life, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: True happiness is devoid of any illusion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: happiness, happy, illusion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, true-happiness

quote: For the one who ‘enjoys’ (worldly) happiness, there will come a time for him to endure sorrow.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: enjoy, happiness, happy, sorrow, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no entanglement where there is truth, and where there is no truth, there is entanglement of playing with ‘toys’ (interaction with people).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: asatya, entangle, satya, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth

quote: The one, whose worldly entanglements have gone, is called the ‘Absolute Person’ (Sampoorna Purush).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absolute, entangle, gnani, gyani, sampoorna, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The world is entrapped through uneasiness, not through diseases (illnesses). Diseases (illnesses) are caused by uneasiness. Do the trees get any diseases (illnesses)? Do the crows become paralyzed or have high blood pressure?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: blood-pressure, diseases, illness, paralyze, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Religion stops the loot of illusion; and through non-religion, the loot of illusion begins.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: illusion, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If there is true ‘Selfishness,’ then there is ‘liberation of the Self’, and that indeed is one’s own form (the Self).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, liberation, moksh, moksha, self, self-realisation, self-realization, selfish, selfishness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-self

quote: Nothing is free in this world. That which comes before you is your very own.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When monetary dealing in religion stops, the religion will manifest its splendor!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: manifest, monetary, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What spreads the stench of bad conduct? It is the egoism and other ‘flaws’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, fault, faults, flaws, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: All that is ‘free of cost’ is compulsory (farajeeyat).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The Right Knowledge reduces pain-and-suffering, and increases happiness. If we fall short of having acquired the Right Knowledge, the faults is ours’, isn’t it?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, happiness, happy, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, mistake, pain, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffering

quote: One cannot see one’s own mistakes in matters where his interest lies.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, mistake, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If one is destined to go wrong, he will not believe the truth but will believe something else altogether.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: destiny, kismat, luck, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: He who does propaganda for something will become famous about it, and if he remains incognito about it, he will become renowned. The value is for the renowned state and not for that of a famous state.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: famous, renowned, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: This world is not at fault, the world is beautiful. If your understanding is wrong, what can the world do?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faultless, flawless, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If there is wrong [ill] on the inside, the outside will appear wrong. Therefore, you should inquire within ‘why am I bothered, when others are not? So there must be wrong within me only.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: know-yourself, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self-realisation, self-realised, self-realization, self-realized, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: As long as this belief, ‘I am the doer’ is not gone, one has not yet attained an iota of exact religion. He is still in the auspicious-inauspicious [shubh-ashubh] state.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ashubh, belief, dharm, dharma, ego, religion, shubh, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: If one takes responsibility for the mistakes, he is the true person, isn’t it? Do not insist. Instead of insisting, instead of blaming others, take the responsibility of the mistakes on your head!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, insists, mistake, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Religion [dharma] originates where there is doer-ship [to do], Moksha [ultimate liberation] originates where there is understanding (to understand).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dharm, dharma, liberation, moksh, moksha, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: That which frees one from bondage is the right religion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dharma, free-from-bondage, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Why should I care?’ – The one who says this is the greatest offender of nature.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The one who straightens out himself will attain moksha [will be liberated]. If you don’t straighten out, people will beat you into doing so. The doorway to moksha [ultimate liberation] is narrow, so how will you be able to enter if you are obstinate?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: liberation, moksh, moksha, obstinate, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no insistence where there is pure love. Insistence is infatuation (deep attachment).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, insistence, love, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Energies are to be expressed precisely with the person you don’t get along with. The energies are already there in dealing with the person you do get along with. ‘Not being able to get along’ is a weakness.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: energies, energy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, weakness

quote: The person who tolerates ‘exactly’ (with understanding) hands over his ‘case’ to nature. There is no need to punish anyone. Nature itself will punish him.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tolerance, tolerate

quote: Tolerance is an attribute of egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tolerance

quote: To know worldly relations as being ‘relation’ (temporary) will resolve everything. However, if they are believed to be true (real) relations, there will be insistence. In relative relations, one is not to prove ‘I am correct’. One has to bring about a closure by saying, ‘you are correct’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: belief, insistence, real-relation, relation, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no Gnan (True Knowledge) where there is ‘egoism’ and where there is Gnan, there is no ‘egoism’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, gnan, gyan, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Someone may have a broken heart or someone may have a broken ego. Such people will have to suffer tremendously because of that.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, heart, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When the whirlpool of thoughts is going on; that is known as the mind. At that time, the mind is functioning independently. That and the vrutis (tendencies of the chit) have no relationship. The tendencies arise later on, and then they go back and forth.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, viruti, vrutis

quote: How can the thoughts be stopped? Tell the thoughts, ‘You take care of your own issues; I am not on your side.’ That way you will sit on God’s side.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: god, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-god, thoughts

quote: The mind that does inner intentions (bhaav-mann) is the ‘charge’ mind. The mind that is getting exhausted (dravya-mann) is the ‘discharge’ mind. Bhaav-mann creates the worldly life. Dravya-mann brings an end to the worldly life. When egoism goes away, bhaav-mann vanishes.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bhaav, bhav, dravya, ego, egoism, intentions, maan, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What does the world teach you? It teaches you (to do) egoism. Then, from that egoism, arise many many phases!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The chit is semi-animate (half-alive) and the mind is completely physical.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is the value of the Gnani’s [the enlightened one’s] feet? It is a value that is immeasurable. The Gnani’s feet is one & the only solvent to dissolve egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, enlighten, enlightened, gnani, gnani-purush, gyani, lotus-feet, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as there is the egoism of ‘I-ness’ (hoonpanu) and the partiality towards ‘my-ness’ (marapanu), how can there be liberation till then?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: In reality, the outer instruments (hands, feet, eyes, etc) are not the hindrance (for liberation); it is the inner instrument (mind, intellect, chit and ego) that is obstructive.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, intellect, liberation, mind, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If you say a word against a ‘sensitive’ person, it will have an immediate effect. In reality, words are simply a ‘record’ playing.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, past-life, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, word, words

quote: Getting rid of the wrong understanding and attaining the right understanding is indeed bliss.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, bliss-definition, define-bliss, meaning-of-bliss, right-understanding, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: What is the difference between disrespect (avinay) and despise (viradhana)? Disrespect (avinay) means one shows lack of respect and to despise (viradhana) means one becomes an adversary (opponent).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: adversary, despise, disrespect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Flaw laden intellect shows faults in others. If you deviate even slightly in the wrong direction, you will see everyone at fault.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faults, intellect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Religion [dharma] is that where there is no irreligion (adharma, immorality). Religion cannot exist where there is irreligion. There can be only one or the other. Behind every intention, there is either [the force of] religion or [the force of] irreligion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: adharma, dharma, immoral, immorality, intention, irreligion, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Gnani Purush’ [the enlightened one] has the [knowledge of the-Self] essence of all religions.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: essence-of-all-religions, gnan, gnani, gnani-purush, gyani, knowledge-of-self, religion, religions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-enlightened-one

quote: One becomes bad himself when he sees or calls others bad. When others appear good to him, he will become good himself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bad, good, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If you praise the virtues of the person who is two degrees higher than you, if you worship him, if you serve him; this is known as aradhana (veneration; worship). If you say bad things about him, defame him; it is known as viradhana (despise). Viradhana (despise) results in your down fall and aradhana (worship) results in your rise upwards.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: aradhana, defame, despise, praise, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, veneration, virtue, virtues, worship

quote: To see others’ faults is a terrible mistake!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: faults, mistake, seeing-faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is the difference between aradhana (worship) and bhajana (to be one with)? Aradhana (worship) means the attention will go over and over again there, and bhajana (oneness) means continuous engrossment. One is to do aradhana (worship) and bhajana (oneness) for only one’s own Self; everything else will carry on naturally.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: aradhana, bhajana, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self, self-realisation, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-self, worship

quote: All day long, no one is at fault for anything. Whatever faults we see; we see them because of our own defects.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: defects, fault, faults, seeing-faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Despise (viradhana) of a Gnani [the enlightened one] creates hindrance in (acquiring right) Knowledge-Vision-Conduct (Gnan-Darshan-Charitra).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charitra, darshan, despise, enlightened-one, gnan, gnani, gyan, gyani, right-conduct, right-knowledge, right-vision, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One will bother you only if you have a karmic account with him. No one can bother you without your signature (karmic cause). All this is due solely to your signature.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: karma, karmic-account, karmic-cause, karmic-effect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To worship means to go higher. If you join the one who has gone higher, you will go higher and if you speak ill of that person, you will fall down.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: humble, humbleness, humility, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: In this world, it is not worth finding anyone’s faults. One becomes bound (by karma) by finding faults.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, fault, faults, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The way in which the twists were entangled to knot up the mind-speech-body and the innate nature (relative self, prakruti), is the manner in which they will be untwisted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: body, entangle, innate-nature, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, manner, mind, prakruti, relative-self, self, speech, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One gets recurrent thoughts about things he had insisted upon and about matters he formed opinions!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, form-an-opinion, insist, insistence, opinion, opinions, recurrent-thoughts, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, thougths, to-form-an-opinion

quote: Once an opinion is formed, there will be attachment-abhorrence. A person without opinion is also without attachment-abhorrence.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, opinion, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One can give ‘correct’ opinion only if one has an open mind.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: correct, open-mind, open-minded, open-minds, openmind, openminded, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Prakruti [the relative self, innate nature] has opinions and may store them but we should stay in an opinion-free state. ‘We’ are separate and the relative self is separate from us. ‘We’ should play our part as a separate entity. We shouldn’t get involved with those problems.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, belief, innate-nature, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, nature, opinion, opinions, prakruti, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Quarrels and differences of opinions are solely due to a flawed-vision.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: conflicts, difference-of-opinion, differences-of-opinion, opinion, opinions, quarrel, quarreling, quarrels, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When one sees his own faults, he will not have the time to see the others’ faults.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faults, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-self

quote: All this has been created from self-fault and self-imagination!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faults, self-imagination, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: This is one place an opinion has to be made: that this body is a betrayal.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: knowledge-of-the-self, knowlegde-of-self, opinion, opinions, self-realisation, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-am-i

quote: One should become free of mistakes so that there will be no superior over him.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Where there is love, there are no faults. Where the love of give-and-take (dealer) arose, all faults will be seen there.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: fault, faults, give-and-take, love, no-fault, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As many opinions you bound about a person, if you let go of them, you will attain a natural state. For whomever and for whatever matter, you have bound opinions, those opinions will continue to sting you and when you let go of those opinions, you can become natural.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, natural, natural-state, opinion, opinions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Where there is insistence, there is tenacity and where there is tenacity, there is anguish.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anguish, insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tenacity

quote: God had said to listen to what five people tell you and don’t hold on to your own opinion. The person who holds on to his opinion is isolated. If you insist upon it, it will harm you as well as others. This true-false is a relative truth; it is a mundane [worldly] truth. One should not insist upon it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: god, harm, insist, insist-upon, isolated, isolation, opinion, real-truth, relative-truth, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, to-insist-upon, truth

quote: In this world, there is nothing that is right. Anything that people raise objection to, is wrong. Do people raise objection in every matter?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: objection, raise-an-objection, raise-objection, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as there is insistence of the truth, one cannot know the Vitarag Lord [the enlightened one].
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: enlightened-one, insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitrag-lord

quote: Where there is insistence, there is worldly life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: Where there is the slightest insistence, there is no religion there!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, insistence, no-religion, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: God has said for us to know bad, as bad and good, as good. But while knowing the bad, there should not be the slightest abhorrence towards it and while knowing the good, there should not be slightest attachment towards it. Without knowing bad, as bad, the good cannot be known as good.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: adhorrence, attachment, bad, god, good, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, the-bad, the-good

quote: To be free of insistence [free of forcing one's own opinion] is the path of Vitragta [attachment-free state, the enlightened one]. Quit insisting at all places. To even insist on the truth, God has considered it as ignorance. There is no insistence in ‘Us’ whatsoever!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, enlightened-one, free-of-insistence, gnani-purush, god, ignorance, insist, opinion, path-of-vitragta, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth, vitrag

quote: Insistence on one’s own opinion can never lead to attainment of Moksha [Ultimate Liberation]. Only those who are free of insistence will attain Liberation.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, liberation, moksh, moksha, opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, ultimate-liberation

quote: In Vitrag-Vignan [science of vitraag lords, the enlightened ones] there cannot be the slightest of the [wrong] insistence; moreover, there can be no insistence on one’s own opinion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: enlightened-one, insist, insistence, lord, opinion, own-opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spiritual-science, vitrag, vitrag-lord, vitrag-vignan

quote: There should be no tenacity of insistence or obstinate insistence of any kind. If there is any tenacity, it should be the kind that will go away if you tell it to!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, insistence, obstinacy, obstinate, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tenacity

quote: There is no truth in this world that is worth insisting upon! Anything that is insisted upon is not the truth at all!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insist, insistence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth, worth

quote: The one, who does not have the ‘poison’ of insistence, will become free from all entanglements (karmic).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: become-free, entanglements, insist, insistence, karma, karmic, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Every human being needs security. The one, who does not have security, will be in fear. So he will look for security outside if he does not get it at home. The Gnani Purush [the enlightened one] is the only one who does not need any security. The Gnani is considered to be free from all dependency (niralamb). Others will take support from Him, but He will not take any support. Only the Gnani Purush can remain free from dependency in this world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dependency, enlightened-one, fear, gnani-purush, niralamb, no-security, security, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, support

quote: As long one is not able to let go of the insistence on a certain opinion [faith, sect], he has not earned the right for Moksha [Ultimate Liberation]. He is not worthy of Moksha if he is in the sect. He is only worthy of material happiness; he is worthy of a celestial life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: celestial-life, faith, happiness, insistence, material-happiness, moksh, moksha, opinion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, ultimate-liberation

quote: If you walk around proudly when someone greets you with respect or says, ‘welcome, welcome’, you will suffer a loss, right? Here, it was the other person’s duty [social obligation] to welcome you, but you shouldn’t fall short. So you should immediately check your balance-sheet (of karma) to find out where you sustained a loss!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: karma, loss, obligation, proud, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: A person who has the slightest fear of insult cannot be called a “Gnani” [the enlightened one] and a person who desires self-recognition [maan] is not a Gnani [the enlightened one].
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desires, ego, enlightened-one, fear, fear-of-insult, gnani, insult, maan, self-recognition, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One does not like insults yet ironically he is an expert in insulting others. How can this be called a human-behavior?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: human-behavior, insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: A person with a large tuber of self-pride remains engrossed in the fear of, ‘Someone is going to insult me…someone is going to insult me’ or ‘From where can I get respect? From where can I get the respect?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, fear, fear-of-insult, insult, pride, recognition, respect, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: After getting respect, one will get an equal amount of insult, if not in this life then the next. If you taste even the slightest of pleasure from this body-complex [pudgal], you will have to pay back an equivalent amount. Therefore become attachment-free (vitarag).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, attachment-free, insult, life, pleasure, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitarag

quote: The higher one sits, the greater the fear of fall.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, fear, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is a tremendous strength to be able to digest an insult.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, strength, tremendous-strength

quote: How can you tell whether the ego is there or not? You will know when someone insults you. If someone insults you, swallow (accept) it with understanding.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, insult, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swallow-the-insult

quote: If one knows how to ‘digest’ an insult after attaining Self-realization, he will become a ‘Gnani’ [the enlightened one]. And if he ‘digests’ an insult before attaining Self-realization, he will become shameless (impudent).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: digest-an-insult, enlightened-one, gnani, knowledge-of-self, knowledge-of-the-self, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To protect one’s own statement is the greatest form of violence. To impress upon others that his statement is correct is a form of violence itself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: greatest-form-of-violence, greatest-violence, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, violence

quote: Awareness’ will not arise where there is deceit along with self-pride (maan). If there is deceit with self-pride, then one can never see the self-pride.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: awareness, deceit, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is arrogant pride (abhimaan)? It is to believe the weight of the body-complex [pudgal] to be one’s own weight. It is to believe that ‘I am Great’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhimaan, arrogant-pride, belief, great, i, i-am, i-am-great, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wrong-belief

quote: Arrogant pride (abhimaan) means public display of self-pride (maan).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhimaan, arrogant-pride, ego, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Self-serving-pride (swamaan) means to take precaution against being insulted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: being-insulted, ego, insult, maan, pride, self-serving-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan

quote: He insulted me’ -this knowledge binds one with terrible demerit karma.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bad-karma, demerit-karma, insult, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Your pride will be uprooted when a person who insults you appears to be your benefactor. The person who insults should be considered a benefactor, instead people get depressed when they are insulted.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: depressed, depression, ego, insult, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: In the worldly life, self-serving pride (swa-maan) is considered a good quality and arrogant pride (abhimaan) as a bad quality.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhimaan, arrogance, arrogant, good-quality, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan

quote: In the ignorant state, there is a ‘limit’ for good qualities, it is known as the self-pride. Self-serving pride (swa-maan) is the limit of virtues in the realm of ignorance.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: good-quality, ignorance, ignorant, maan, pride, self-pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, swamaan, virtue

quote: In regards to maan (to seek importance from others), a man will become impudent if he keeps getting insulted up to a point. If he gets maan (importance from others) to a certain level, he grows stronger. And if he gets too much maan [praise], then his desire for it will come to end.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, importance, insult, insults, maan, praise, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If one man gets excessive maan (importance from others) higher than a certain point, he will get tired of it, and if he gets excessive insults higher than a certain point, he gets agitated.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: agitated, agitation, insult, insults, maan, respect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One will become shameless if he does not fear insults in the worldly life. And in nischay [determination in the spiritual life] if one does not fear being insulted, he becomes independent.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: independent, insult, insults, nischay, shameless, spiritual, spiritual-life, spiritual-quotes, wordly-life

quote: One cannot have the same love for getting insulted (apmaan) as he does for getting importance (maan), can he? He cannot love loss as much as he loves profit, can he?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: apmaan, importance, important, insult, insults, maan, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Even if you insult him, he gives you his blessings; such a one only is the Gnani Purush [The enlightened one]!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bless, blessing, englightened-one, gnani-purush, insult, insults, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: For how long will insult hurt a person? For as long as he covets self-importance. For as long as one covets temporary [non eternal] things.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: arrogance, arrogant, ego, insult, self-importance, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no problem to relish pride when people praises you but at the same time, one must also be of the opinion that ‘this should not be so’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, praise, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as man has pride, he will appear unattractive and no one will be attracted to him. He may have a handsome face, his pride makes him unattractive.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: appearance, attraction, attractive, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, unattractive

quote: The slightest awareness of ‘my-ness’ is indeed egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: awareness, ego, egoism, my-ness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There is no ‘my’ in ‘I’. ‘My’ is outside of the ‘I’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, i, my, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Egoism [Ahamkar: Aham=I; kar=did] means ‘I did’. Where one is not the doer and he says, ‘I did’; that is egoism. To do egoism and to walk around with an inflated chest is pride (maan) and then to go on telling others ‘I did it myself’, is known as pride with my-ness (abhiman).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhiman, egoism, maan, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is the body-complex that eats and one just does the egoism of ‘I ate.’ He is not aware that there is another entity. One simply takes on the suffering of another.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: aware, awareness, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffering

quote: Who can go beyond the mind? The one who has conquered the mind.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: conquer-the-mind, control-the-mind, mind, mind-control, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Those vibrations that we created have indeed fall upon us. Only those acts that were done in the ignorant (Self unawareness) state, that has given us reactions.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cause, effect, ignorance, karma, self-awareness, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If a person does five samayiks (introspective meditation) he will say, ‘I did five’- and this is how he will taste the sweetness of the subtle-pride of doership. Actually what he should say is, ‘it was due to God’s grace that I was able to do five samayik’. He should not taste the sweetness of subtle pride of doership.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: doership, meditation, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The worldly life has persisted due to imitation of worldly movements and by opposing them, one becomes free.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: free, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: The mind can be won over if it is kept separate from things that appeal to it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: control-the-mind, mind, mind-control, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Until Self-realization is attained; it is not worth having a fixed-view at any place, it is not worth having habitual-devotion at any place and it is not worth stopping anywhere.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: devotion, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Whatever activity one sees in this world, it is discharge of previously charged karma. Man has nothing to do with it. He only does egoism here of, ‘I did samayik (introspective meditation).’ He creates a karmic account! He becomes entrapped! He takes enjoyment from tasting sweetness of subtle pride of doer-ship.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge-karma, discharge, discharge-karma, doership, egoism, enjoyment, karma, karmic-account, meditation, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: He who controls the minds of others is a ‘Gnani’ (the enlightened one). Only when your mind is completely under your control, can other’s mind come under your control. How can the other persons mind come under your control when one has disturbances himself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: control-the-mind, enlightened-one, enlightenment, gnani, gnani-purush, mind, mind-control, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As many numbers of people as are there, there are that many varieties of egoisms.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, types-of-egoism, varieties-of-egoism

quote: No one is a doer in this world. To claim, ‘I am doing’ is egoism. Illusion continues to prevail under the umbrella of egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: doer, ego, egoism, illusion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The rule is that when one’s mind is controlled in a specific subject, he can control the other person’s mind in that subject.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Where our own mind doesn’t listen to us, how can other’s minds follow what we say? One should not have such expectation at all.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: expect, expectation, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Nothing can get spoilt as long the mind is steady, and when it becomes restless, it will spoil. God doesn’t give or take from anyone, but because God is in the permanent blissful state, all external actions will go well when one’s mind is steadied in Him.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, blissful-state, god, mind, restless, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When there is no venom (poison) of any kind in your eyes, when a liberated smile is seen, then people will do your darshan (will come to see you with intent of worship).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: darshan, liberate, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When you become worthy of people’s worship, you will be able to attain moksha (liberation), you cannot go to moksha just like that. Reproach (criticism) by people is the cause of a life in the lower realms.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: criticism, criticize, liberation, life, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: He whose speech, behavior and humility captivates people’s minds, becomes worthy of worship by people.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: behavior, humility, speech, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: The one who is worthy of worship by people has no desires. The one who is unworthy of worship has desires.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, no-desires, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: What is called true happiness? It is 'chit prasannta' (blissful state of chit). The person who has attained 'chit prasannta', he need not beg for anything in this world!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: beg, bliss, blissful-state, chit, happiness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, true-happiness

quote: God has called 'chit prasannta' (blissful state of chit) as happiness. Even when someone swears at you, picks your pocket; the 'chit prasannta' doesn’t go away! Even at two o’clock in the morning, the 'chit prasannta' does not go away.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, blissful-state, chit, happiness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: A place where the mind can attain stillness meaning doing darshan (seeing with the intent of worship) of a great person who has stillness of the mind, can still the mind of other person, however the chit is not steady there.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: chit, darshan, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worship

quote: When the mind is steady, it will not create any vibrations, and therefore one will get the result. Along with that, if there is purity of chit, then one will surely be able to get his work done.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: chit, mind, pure, purity, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Mind is indeed that which takes one to Moksha, and it is also the mind that makes one wander around in the worldly life. One needs to just turn it in the right direction. It had been turned in the wrong direction, and so it needs to be turned in the right direction.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: liberation, mind, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The thoughts that arise because of 'depression' or 'elevation' are all wrong thoughts. The thoughts that arise in 'normality' are 'correct'.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: depression, elevation, normality, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, thoughts

quote: Thought is actually something that is dead, it is not a living thing. If ‘oneself’ gets engrossed in what is dead, then it will become alive.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: engross, engrossed, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, thought

quote: After establishing anything as the absolute truth, its’ conclusion is reached. It doesn’t have to be established as the truth again. What is proven as the eternal established truth for past, present and future is known as the Principle [Siddhant].
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: absolute-truth, eternal, future, past, present, principle, siddhant, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth

quote: Regardless of how much wealth [material pleasures] one has, if he does not like bondage even for a moment, then he has become qualified to understand the science of the Vitarags [the enlightened one’s].
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bondage, enlightened, enlightened-one, material-pleasure, science-of-the-vitarags, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wealth

quote: When the mind gets a solution [settlement], it is considered religion. It is considered irreligion when the mind does not get a solution.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, religion, solution, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: I know’, is a big ghost. ‘This is mine’, is a huge demonic possession!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, know, mine, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, yours

quote: Principle’ [Established Truth] means everywhere applicable; when there is nothing else, it is called Principle.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: applicable, principle, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth

quote: Only the ‘Right belief’ gives rise to non-contradicting principle and that which is free from contradiction is known as ‘Principle’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: belief, contradiction, free-from-contradiction, principle, right-belief, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: That which never attains a state of non-principle [non-truth] is known as the principle.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: principle, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, truth

quote: When there is no argument [dispute] over a talk, it is called ‘Principle’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: argument, dispute, principle, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Who is considered as reputable in God’s language? The one who can do ‘world’s salvation’ just through his eyes!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: god, reputable, salvation, salvation-by-grace, salvation-of-the-world, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The inner intent one has of ‘may everyone attain salvation’, will bring salvation to himself first.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: inner-intent, salvation, salvation-by-grace, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: There can never be suffering in the home of a person who is working for world's salvation.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: salvation, salvation-by-grace, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffer, suffering

quote: The mud of this body-complex (pudgal - that which charges and disharges) is such that the harder one tries to get out, the deeper and deeper he sinks into it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: pudgal, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To see happiness of others, that is what is our religion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: be-happy, happiness, happy, religion, see-others-happy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Every man should care (be concerned) about these three things: Which station have I come from? Which station did I get off? Which station am I going to?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: care, goal, purpose, show-concern, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The world will praise you one moment and defame you the next. So why should we care for praise or defamation?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: defame, praise, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Who is considered a great man is the one who can be the smallest of the small.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: great-man, humble, humblest, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is called understanding when one accepts other’s talks of wisdom; but, where is the wisdom filled talk in this era?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: acceptance, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, understanding, wisdom

quote: When others try to provoke (instigate) you and you don’t get provoked, it is known as a spiritual victory.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: instigate, provoke, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: No matter what kind of circumstances come together, if one’s stillness is not shaken and his goal does not change; he is known to have attained religion.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: goal, purpose, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, stillness

quote: Religion means researching the true Eternal thing with Deluded world view (with wrong belief) and ‘this’ (akram vignan) is a science itself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: akram-vignan, belief, delusion, eternal, religion, spiritual, spiritual-science, spritual-quotes

quote: This’ is not called a religion, ‘This’ is called a science (vignan). Religion keeps changing, science does not change.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: religion, science, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vignan

quote: What does religion say? It says that if you care for others then you will meet others who will care for you and if you hit others, you will meet others who will hit you. This is what all relative religions say.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: care, care-for-others, dharma, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Religion begins from the time man starts to give happiness to others.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: give-happiness-to-others, happiness, happiness-to-others, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Only one kind of religion cannot give peace to everyone. Whatever ‘degree’ one is sitting at, that ‘degree’ of religion he requires.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dharma, inner-peace, peace, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: True religion is that which does not let you stumble.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, stumble, true-religion

quote: As much purity one has within, his external circumstances will be that much more favorable. As much impurity there is within, there will be a corresponding amount of unfavorable external circumstances.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: favorable, impure, impurity, pure, purity, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, unfavorable

quote: When attachment increases too much, dislike will arise.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, dislike, like, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is the nature of the circumstances to disperse. If there is attachment with the circumstance, there will be abhorrence when they get dispersed.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, circumstance, disperse, gather, nature, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As illusory attachment (moha) spread, one sunk deeper and deeper into the pit.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, illusory-attachment, moh, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When many circumstances come together, one will get food to eat. When many circumstances come together, one gets to go hungry (one will not get food to eat). One goes hungry when many more circumstances come together. A greater number of circumstances are needed for an unfavorable situation, and less for favorable situation.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: circumstance, favorable, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, unfavorable

quote: Egoism has arisen due to circumstances and circumstances have survived due to egoism. The one whose egoism is gone, for him circumstances are gone. Everything has come into existence because of wrong belief.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: belief, circumstance, ego, egoism, right-belief, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wrong-belief

quote: God said to accept whatever circumstances that come along. Circumstance is a natural thing. In it, ‘Do this and don’t do that’- should not be there. Circumstances are a ‘scientific circumstantial evidence’ [‘Vyavasthit’]. You should ‘settle them with equanimity’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: accept, acceptance, circumstance, equanimity, god, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Moksha (Liberation) is to become free from gathering & dispersing of circumstances.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: circumstance, disperse, free, gather, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Abhorrence is the cause for conflicts. God has said, ‘Do no abhorrence. If you don’t like it, ignore it’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, cause, conflict, dislike, effect, god, like, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Who is free from illusory attachment (nirmohi)? The Gnani Purush (the enlightened one). He can see flesh and bones, through and through.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, enlightened, enlightened-one, gnan, gnani, gnani-purush, moh, moha, nirmohi, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Causes for attachment are created at the very time abhorrence occurs. Familiarity (acquaintance) up to a certain point will result in attachment and if it reaches ‘ridge point’ & goes past further, it will result in abhorrence.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, cause, effect, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is attraction (akarshan) in this world? It is open fire and one should be aware of it. Attraction is the open fire. The root of illusory attachment (moha) is indeed attraction.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: akarshan, attachment, attraction, illusory-attachment, moh, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Illusory attachment (moha) is indeed what will keep on biting you until the point of your demise!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, illusory-attachment, moh, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What does greed mean? Greed means taking away what belongs to others.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: greed, sharing, spiritual, spiritual-quote, take-away

quote: Those who have anger, they try to take control others with the heat of anger and those who do not have anger are able to take control of others with their strength of character known as sheel. Even it can take control of animals (with it’s strength)!!!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, character, control, sheel, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, strength

quote: Absence of Kashays (anger-pride-deceit-greed) is indeed bliss.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, bliss, deceit, gree, happiness, kashay, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When does one become free from all tubers (of the mind)? When one becomes free of kashayas (anger-pride-deceit-greed). Kashays (anger-pride-deceit-greed) are tubers themselves.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, deceit, greed, kashay, mind, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tubers-of-the-mind

quote: Complete departure of kashay (anger-pride-deceit-greed) is Moksha (Liberation). At first, there is the departure of kashays and then there will be ‘that’ [Liberation].
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, deceit, greed, kashay, liberation, moksha, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One does not see ‘what is there’ and sees ‘what is not there’, that is called moha (illusory vision).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: illusion, illusory-vision, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Moha (illusory vision) means new things keep arising, and one indeed sees new things; and he remains engrossed in them.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: engross, engrossed, illusory, illusory-vision, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vision

quote: To lose awareness of what is helpful or harmful in the worldly life is moh (Illusory vision & attachment).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, awareness, harmful, helpful, illusion, illusory-vision, moh, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vision, worldly-life

quote: Egoism’s nature is not Moha (Illusory attachment). Moha’s (Illusory attachment’s) nature is egoism. Moha is the origin of egoism.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, ego, egoism, egoistic, illusory-attachment, moh, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Who gives you pain? Your anger, pride, illusion and greed. Where is the fault of the nature in all this?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, fault, greed, illusion, nature, pain, pride, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffering

quote: Religion (Dharma) begins with an obliging nature.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dharma, nature, obliging-nature, religion, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When can one attain samadhi (eternal blissful continuous peace)? It comes when one lets go of the things that he loves the most.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, eternal-bliss, let-go, love, peace, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Where one does not do planning, it is all pure ‘discharge’. ‘Charge’ occurs where there is planning. Discharge is a natural characteristic. There is no pain in it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, discharge, karma, pain, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Marriage results in two possibilities: sometimes it results in prosperity, sometimes it results in destruction.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: destruction, love, marriage, prosperity, pure-love, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: People are preoccupied only with money. They are looking to see where they can get it from. Hey, why are you looking for it in a ‘cemetery’? This worldly life has become like a cemetery. There is no love to be seen in it. The way in which money comes to one is a natural thing. It is (by way of) scientific circumstantial evidences. Why do we have to run after it? If it were to free (liberate) us itself, then it would be very good, right?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: life, love, money, pure-love, scientific-circumstances, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: The awareness that ‘money will get spent’ must never be kept; whatever gets spent at whatever time is correct. That’s why it was told to spend money, so that they can be free from greed and they can give it again and again.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: awareness, freedom-from-greed, greed, money, spending-money, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Money is ‘limited’ and people’s demands are ‘unlimited’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: demands, money, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Is it not necessary to eat? Is it not necessary to go to the toilet? They are necessary. In the same way, money is also required. Just as one does not have to think about going to the toilet; it happens automatically, in the same way, money comes without you having to think about it.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: money, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Do you have to regret spending money when you earn money? And when it is time to spend, you should be strong that you got the opportunity to pay off your debt. Income is one’s responsibility and expense is the means to clear off the responsibility.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: debt, income, money, paying-debts, responsibility, spending-money, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: If money is spent in the wrong way, then ‘control’ the spending and if the money is spent in the right way, then ‘decontrol’ the spending.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: money, spending, spending-money, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: When anyone can still the minds of five, ten or hundred people, then work can be accomplished. Who can still the mind? It is the one whose own mind is still, he can still the minds of others.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, spiritual-quotes

quote: The mind and the chit are discharging and the world has believed them to be ‘charge’. That is why they attempt to still the mind and the chit, but that is not possible.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, chit, discharge, mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, still-the-mind

quote: If one’s mind becomes conflict-free, that is ‘moksha’; conflict filled mind, that is worldly life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: conflict-free, conflicts, liberation, mind, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: No difficulty can come to you (your way). If the mind wavers, difficulty will embrace you! That is all, the law of the universe is just this.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: mind, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, wavering-mind

quote: One becomes all encompassing (sarvasva, the work is completed), when one can see the world as completely faultless (nirdosh).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: completely, faultless, spiritual-quotes, world

quote: In this world, there are instruments to acquire instruments; ‘here’, there is the instrument to attain the Final Goal (Self Realization).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: instruments, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spirituality, world

quote: The world is stuck because of the word ‘no’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: no, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, world, yes

quote: The whole world has the illusory awareness of, ‘I am the doer’. In reality, everyone’s karmas are getting discharged, but one is not aware of this. One has no awareness of his own True Self.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: awareness, illusory-awareness, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, world

quote: Where do you see conflict in this world? Only where there is infatuation (attachment).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, conflict, conflict-free, infatuation, raag, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, world

quote: To see anything other than ‘as it is’ - that is called the world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: illusion, illusionary-vision, spiritual, vision, world

quote: The world is the puzzle, itself; but it is always in principle.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: in-principle, puzzle, spiritual, world

quote: The world is not worthless but one should know how to get work done from it, because everyone is God, they all have different work to do. Therefore do not have dislike for anything in this world.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dislike, god, like, spiritual, world

quote: One is worthy as a son when he removes all his father’s troubles.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: child, children, father, father-and-son, fathers-and-sons, parenting, parents, son, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One comes back [reborn] as a son because of harmony with us [from the past life] and one comes back as a son also because of enmity [vengeance from the past life], [but] needlessly arises the illusion [wrong belief] that ‘they are mine...they are mine’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: belief, harmony, illusion, past-life, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is natural for a person to make a mistake (commit a fault). What is the way to become free from that? Only the Gnani Purush [the enlightened one] can show it, (which is) ‘Pratikraman’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: enlightened, fault, gnani-purush, natural, person, spiritual-quotes

quote: One first celebrates a ‘silver jubilee’, then a ‘golden jubilee’, then a ‘diamond jubilee’, but even then he goes back again into a pile of wood (cremation).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: celebrate, spiritual-quotes, spiritual-wisdom

quote: People say that a person has a fever, when [in reality] the fever is leaving! The fever which accumulated within the body as a result of abnormal food, the body’s vitality power then creates the fever for the purpose of purification.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual-quotes

quote: A thing or one’s eyes are not maya (deceit), but the attraction that occurs due to the sense is maya!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: religion, spiritual-quotes

quote: The worldly life just goes round and round; there is no end to it. If you want to bring an end to it, ask the Gnani Purush [The enlightened one], ‘How long do I have to keep on wandering? I have been going round and round like the ox running the millwheel. Tell the Gnani Purush ‘please bring about a resolution for me!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: enlightened, gnani-purush, millwheel, resolution, spiritual-quotes, wander, worldly-life

quote: When one conducts himself in the wrong direction, he goes downward and his conduct in the right direction will take him upward!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: downward-and-upward, drive-himself, drive-yourself, himself, spiritual-quotes

quote: The intellect perpetuates the worldly life.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: spiritual-growth, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: Illusion (maya) cannot enter where there is ‘light’ (enlightenment, awareness). Once darkness falls, illusion will enter there. The Gnani Purush can arrange for your illusion to go away permanently.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dark, enlightenment, gnan, gnani, gyan, gyani, illusion, maya, spiritual-growth, spiritual-quotes

quote: If someone finds a flaw [shortcoming] in us, know that there is imperfection [defect] in us. However, it is a different matter if that person has a habit of talking negatively, but generally that is not the case.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: defect, flaw, imperfection, spiritual-growth, spiritual-quotes

quote: The one who has developed a habit of taking a lot of respect from others [relish pride], will get cheated.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cheat, cheated, pride, respect, spiritual-growth, spiritual-quotes

quote: Till the chit is in blissful state, the world does not come in one's remembrance (one forgets the world till that time).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bliss, blissful-state, chit, memory, spiritual-quotes, spritual

quote: A circumstance is not easy to come by and when it does, there are causes behind it. Therefore I do those things which bring an end to all the causes.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: cause, circumstance, effect, spirital, spiritual-quotes

quote: The true instrument is that, with the help of which, the egoism and my-ness goes away.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, mamata, mamta, my-ness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Scriptures are as ‘helping problem’. Scriptures only give directions. Scriptures are like a thermometer. Can you grind a thermometer and give it as medicine?
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: directions, scriptures, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spirituality

quote: Whatever work you do in this world; the work itself has no value. If there is attachment-abhorrence behind that work, then only you are responsible for the next life. You are not responsible if attachment-abhorrence don’t occur.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, life, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, work

quote: Ego will always conduct itself to make sure that it does not appear bad.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bad, conduct, ego, egoism, good, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: God says only one thing if you want to have attachment towards worldly life; go ahead and get attached to it; or else, get attached to Me. If you get attached to Me, you will get permanent happiness and if you get attached to the worldly life, you will not find contentment!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: attachment, contentment, god, happiness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, worldly-life

quote: If you want to go to moksha (attain ultimate liberation), you will have to become simple and straightforward. Being obstinate won’t work there. You will have to remove all the tubers; become totally free from intellect (abudh).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abudh, budh, intellect, intellect-free, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One should not be obstinate even in worldly interaction. If you are obstinate with a ‘collector’, what will he do? He will throw you in jail. So then what will happen if you are obstinate with God? God won’t put you in jail, but his happiness upon you will break (will go away).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: god, happiness, obstinacy, obstinate, spiritual-quotes

quote: What is it that doesn’t allow you to go to moksha? Obstinacy!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: liberation, moksh, moksha, obstinacy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One is to cross this ocean in the form of obstinacy. We are standing on this side of obstinacy and we have to go to the other side. If someone becomes instrumental in removing your obstinacy; do not be disturbed about it, consider him to be extremely beneficial and undergo that experience with equanimity.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: equanimity, obstinacy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Once the entrancement (Infatuation; Deluded state), in material objects, is gone; the loss in spirituality stops!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: delusion, entrancement, infatuation, material-objects, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spirituality

quote: If one has egoism without my-ness, he will go to moksha; all this entrapment is there because of egoism with my-ness!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, liberation, mamata, moksh, moksha, my-ness, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Gnani Purush’ (the enlightened one) is considered to be the owner of the whole universe. And yet, there is not the slightest egoism in Him. Where there is no authority, there is egoism and where there is authority, there is no egoism. This is the wonder of ‘Gnani Purush!’ ‘Gnani Purush’ is the manifest light.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, enlightened, enlightened-one, enlightenment, gnani-purush, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Illusion (moha) is to take a beating and then forget, to take another beating and then forget again.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: illusion, moha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is called equanimity when one has no attachment with the good (the auspicious) and no abhorrence for the bad (the inauspicious). The one without duality is in equanimity-state. In worldly interactions, people identify tolerance as equanimity!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, auspicious, duality-of-opposites, equanimity, good, inauspicious, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tolerance

quote: Equanimity means that one does not do abhorrence at the time of abhorrence (generating incidents) and one does not do attachment at the time of attachment (generating incidents).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: abhorrence, attachment, equanimity, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: What does Jinmudra (Tirthankar God’s sitting posture) say? The lotus position of Vitrag Lords, one hand and foot placed over the other, preaches, “Oh, humans! Understand this if you have the wisdom. You have already brought with you the food, drink and all things you need; therefore, let go of the awareness that ‘I am the doer’ and make effort to attain Moksha (ultimate liberation)!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: awareness, god, jinmudra, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, tirthankar, vitrag, vitrag-lord, who-is-the-doer, wisdom

quote: Egoism devours all the energy, and in addition it makes one suffer.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, energy, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suffer, sufferer, suffering

quote: Where there is even the subtlest desire, the ‘Eternal Thing’ cannot be attained.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, eternal, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Obstacles (antray) are indeed due to desires. As desires keep on decreasing, so do the obstructions (antray) keep on getting destroyed. Then, everything is acquired (at that stage).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: antray, desire, obstacles, obstructions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Why is it that ‘we’ (the Gnani Purush, the enlightened one) do not have any obstruction (antray)? It is because ‘we’ are in a desire-free state (Nirichchhak dasha).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: antray, desire, desire-free, enlightened, enlightened-one, gnani-purush, obstruction, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: We’ (the Gnani Purush, the enlightened one) have only one desire, and that too is a discharging desire of doing ‘Jagat kalyan’ (world’s salvation).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, enlightened, enlightened-one, gnani-purush, salvation-of-the-world, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, world-salvation

quote: One who speaks ‘completely’ negative creates karmic obstructions (antray) and ‘positive’ does not create any obstruction (antray).
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: antray, karma, karmic-obstructions, negative, negativity, obstruction, positive, positivity, spiritual, spiritual-quotes
