quote: Desires occur because pratyakhyan [resolutions to not repeat the mistake] were not done. It comes in the memory because pratikraman [repentances] were not done.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: desire, memory, mistakes, pratikraman, pratyakhyan, repentance, resolution, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Everything that is experienced through the five senses is all ‘discharge’. It is due to one’s merit karmas that everything works according to one’s wishes, but he claims, ‘I did it’ and when one faces losses, he will say, ‘God did it’ or ‘my horoscope is unfavorable’.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: doer, doership, god, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Charge’ means coming together of all the circumstances and ‘discharge’ means the circumstances get over.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, circumstance, discharge, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: It is called as ‘discharge’ (karma) when one has to do it compulsorily and against his wishes.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, discharge, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: As long as the awareness of ‘doer-ship’ is there, till then, one keeps on ‘charging’ (karma). In the Akram-path, ‘we’ (the Gnani Purush) destroy your doer-ship. The awareness that ‘I am the doer’ goes away and we give the understanding of ‘who the doer is’. Therefore, ‘charging’ (of karma) stops! What is left now? Only the ‘discharge’ is left.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: akram-path, doership, gnani-purush, karma, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, who-is-the-doer

quote: Where the ‘charging’ (of karma) stops, there lies the symptoms (signs) of attaining moksha.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, discharge, karma, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: One’ is not a doer in this world. Where he believes that he is the doer, there is ‘charging’ (of karma). When one tastes egoistic pride of, “I did this samayik, I did these activities”, he will ‘charge’ (karma). The taste of egoistic pride is very sweet.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: charge, discharge, doer, ego, egoism, karma, pride, samayik, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Anger-pride-deceit-greed are in the form of ‘discharge’. But if one does not have ‘knowledge of True Self’ (realization of the self), then he ‘charges’ new karmas within.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: anger, charge, deceit, discharge, greed, karma, knowledge-of-true-self, pride, self-realization, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To run the worldly life, Egoism is not required. To bind [karma] for the next life, Egoism is required. If one doesn’t want the bondage for the next life, then also it is possible to conduct the worldly life without egoism. Entire worldly life is in the ‘discharge’ form. So it will continue to ‘discharge’ by itself.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: bondage, charge, discharge, ego, egoism, karma, life, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: This is not suitable for me”- to say this is indeed madness, it is nothing but egoism. To say ‘will not suit’ is an offense.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: ego, egoism, offense, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, suitable

quote: To say that, “I will not agree (will not accept)” is great egoism!
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: accept, acceptance, agree, egoism, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: To have a desire means to have dependency.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: dependency, desire, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Gnan (knowledge of the Self) can never become agnan (knowledge other than the self, of relative world). It is called agnan only when the focused applied awareness of the Self changes.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: atma-soul, awareness, gnan, knowledge-of-the-self, self, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: The person who wants to progress on the path of Vitrag (the enlightened ones), should keep the focus of the awareness to progress from the non-auspicious (bad) to the auspicious (good). And if one wants to go to final Liberation [moksha], he should keep ‘pure focus as the Self (Soul)’ (shuddha upayog). The person, who wants to go to Moksha, should not concern himself with the auspicious (good) or the inauspicious (bad). He should keep them both as the things to be cleared out.
author: Dada Bhagwan
category: auspicious, awareness, enlightened, enlightened-one, liberation, moksh, moksha, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, vitrag

quote: Who is considered as not living in the worldly life? The person who doesn’t have focus on the non-Self. ‘I’ (the Gnani Purush) do not live in the worldly life even for one moment. Liberation (Moksha) is to be found through the one who does not live in the worldly life. What can you not attain through the grace of such a person?
author: Dada Bhagwan
